column2: SkYLiNe17NZ, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Well Ive been taking Dilantin for almost 10 years now and I just started taking Keppra as well because the Dilantin and Gabapentin I am taking werent working properly.  I ran out of the Keppra the other day and ended up having a seizure where I work although I wasnt on the clock, i just stopped in to get something.  and ended up busting 3 of my three and having to have my top lip stitched back on :( not fun but the keppra really helps and since ive been taking it I havent even blacked out like I do with the dilantin.

column9: Hi,I'm 39 a severe migraine sufferer for about 5 years.My headaches/migraines have became worse the past few months.I've notice slurred speech, saying different words for objects like onion for oven, and even having trouble spelling now.anyway went to er 6-14 and they gave me a huge dose of dilantin iv.it made my migraine numb,then we came home and i felt very anxiuos and ready to scream at someone which happens to be my kids.which i love with my whole life!!!! so my husband took over thank god. after all that we got home about5pm i had to take a vicodin around 630pm to get any releif. so i really dont know if it was worth it or.I JUST WANT THESE CLUSTER MIGRAINES GONE!!!!!

column2: karr3126, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using the medication for about 3 months due to I had a seizure for the first time. I also had surgury last year to remove a brain tumor. Recently I have felt and shown approximately 6-9 symtoms for the effect of the medication. I was precribe to to take four pills a day due to I am a big guy (245 lbs). I had recent blood work and my blood rangs results should have been between 10-20. It was 39, twice the limit. This is when I found out thru my doctor and reading about if on your website that I probably have toxicity (probably spelt is wrong). I haven't fealt like I have had any energy in a long time since taking this medication. I am a outgoing person. Sharp as a tact. I am a security director. Now I walk slow, nerves acts up, can't concentrate, unbalanced and list the list goes on from what I read about the side effects. I am in the process of taking more lab work and the level in my system is reducing. Hopefully in a couple days it will be normal and my doctor will see if I need to take 3 pills a day or less. I can not pass judgments on the medication due to it is helping to say my life but at this point I am not sure if its the medication, myself or a counteraction from my brain sugury. My surgury was almost a year ago, It was not cancersous and for the most part no complications on a daily baisis except a little short term memory loss.
